cpEyfeMsppIYNQZ0rf4xLQ.text: The drinks were good but the price tag left me feeling incredibly upset. My waitress was super nice, but the place was crowded. For every pro, I find a con. I am glad I went here because after my experience I was able to sleep through my entire flight (pro tip: take a Dramamine after drinks and thank me later). Unfortunately, I now do not have enough money to take an airplane again because my drinks were so expensive. With every rainbow comes rain.

RaWDC0voXpKtj9zdQ1b5UA.text: Their express to go section is a joke! It took them more than 20 mins for a toast and still no response. Even people who ordered before me were waiting. I had to board my flight so I had to leave the order after paying for it. Way to go!

gjzOApxiX98bRrcgUXWUbg.text: I wish I could give this brewery 0 stars! Went here today before a flight and got food poisoning from bad salmon! Almost missed the flight and had to board with a wheel chair. Never eat at the sit down area unless you want salmonella !!!!

TOztzuCeWNSxlnSNc9sWoQ.text: The beer selection is awesome and the service is top notch. Staff is very knowledgable. Food is amazing.

nq_IGIaNnGhhDQ4waHW6kg.text: Happy with our drinks and our Fries! Service was fantastic!! Thanks Christina!! Area was clean. Good prices

Sxy36qouT1_S05bbM9qfEg.text: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. We wanted to sit eat a late lunch have a few drinks before we had to catch our flight. After being ignored for 15 minutes I had to go to the server stand where they were all hanging around talking and ask who our server was. After 5 more minutes the guy I asked came to get our drink orders. Our drinks have been empty for 10 mins and I had to ask again again for help. I've never had to beg to spend money before   I have no clue how I'm going to get a food order here. ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS!!! But wait there's more. We had to chase our server down two more times for drinks and My wife is a pescatarian and ordered the fish sticks and one of them was a chicken strip.  Ugh. THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE

heZMORz4oZO4KgnK657N5w.text: Airport restaurants are rarely that great, and this is no exception. Our server was chatting up with all her friends/customers and it got pretty loud for a good while, which irritated my anxiety-prone husband. Food also took a while, and all was rather mediocre. Let me go into detail:  Buffalo Wings: These were decent, though the (what I assume was blue cheese) dip was very light and didn't do so much for the wings. For a girl who was mad craving some wings, this will suffice.  Salad: Honestly, it was so mediocre I don't even remember it. I just remember eating it all and being okay. Yup, just okay.   Everything here was really A-OK. I don't know what else to tell you. Even the beer selection is mediocre and for a "brewing company," there really isn't much. Maybe I should've stuck to the burger; hubby had the burger and said it was pretty good. Honestly, I wouldn't come here again unless I had to.

TbyvZUqIY9m6azci_uvwRQ.text: Friendly greeting upon arriving, which is nice for an airport location. My server was also friendly, which was nice. Had breakfast m, which wasn't overly impressive. The order came out pretty quickly (again good considering we are in an airport) but the potatoes were not st all appealing and looked like they'd been cooked a few days ago and reheated several times. Why four stars then? Well they get bonus points for the service, the constant coffee refills, the cleanliness, and the power outlets available at many seating spaces.

photos.caption: Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eqp5O3Y4ND0Zl4xOAd8ouQ.text: Came in 5 mins before Kitchen closed and we went to the to-go area. Me and my mom ordered the Francia dip and a brownie. The lady that helped us was good, but then we wanted to sit down. We attempt to go to the only sitting area I'm aware of and this rude (looked like) bald manager told us that we couldn't sit there. I understood. Makes sense. Oh there is another sitting area for the to go orders alright but this man didn't calmly explain that. Instead he had a tone and spoke down to us. To say the least we were peeved  Other than that the Francia dip was good. My mom enjoyed it. I thought the bread was too salty. Comes with fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Unfortunate customer service here.... Especially the bold guy

dvXnt8LoU2PuFtHTt9PTAQ.text: I have been to this airport a few times over the past year and the same hostess is the reason for this review. Today, we approached the ToGo station and my bf was on the phone so I stepped aside to give him some time to finish. She finally came to the ToGo station but didn't say a word. She looked annoyed.. It was then that I recognized that she was the same one I've seen with that "stank face" the past few times. The unwelcoming energy is why we didn't dine there those times before bit today, we were starving and wanted to give the place a shot. After my bf finished his call we decided to dine in. As we approached the hostess counter, the same girl was there with the same annoyed look on her face and she seemed to have been bothered by whatever it was the blond haired gentleman, who was also working there, was saying to her in her ear. She rolled her eyes and chewed her gum carelessly. After excusing myself for the interrupting their dialogue, I asked her if it was ok if I can see a menu in reach she didn't even look at me to say yes or ok. This upset me. My bf told her that we will dine in and "she asked bar or table" and he said table and she just grabbed the menus very sluggishly and walked us to our table where she just put the menus on the table and walked away without a word. No thanking us for dining with them... no hospitality. Baylee, out server definitely changed our mood. She happily greeted us with a smile and her service felt genuine. She was the only server who I noticed wasnt chit chatting with the other staff and checking empty tables and pusing in chairs. She seemed to be the only one working with a smile. And if you see this Baylee, we thank you. In regards to the food, we ordered the Southwest Burger, southwest chicken rolls, and (I can't remember the name) these fries smothered with pork. I would recommend the pork fries. SO DELICIOUS and full of flavor. The meat juices complemented the fries perfectly. The Southwest Burger was also great and meat was cooked to perfection. I do not recommend the chicken rolls because it was dry and hard to take down. It was like trying to empty a can of tuna.. overall 1 star for ambiance,  1 star for speedy service, and 1 star for food taste.

RlSSNj1wYnx-z1H3hEl4RQ.text: The Acid rock music in this place is so loud it was extremely hard to enjoy our breakfast. If you don't like whom you are traveling with, this might be a good place because it is next to impossible to have a conversation

mSDjHl9HLmxkuicaQq_sIA.text: I wasn't planning on yelping this location, and I didn't take pictures of anything besides a beer... but after enjoying some amazing hummus with fresh pita and veggies... my son thoroughly enjoying a perfectly cooked burger, and the most amazing French fries we've ever had... I decided we really needed to report on this. The atmosphere is casual, the servers are great. Travis Sayer was our server, and he was unbelievable! So prompt, attentive, informative, friendly, etc. he needs a raise! The brews are stellar. Tilted kilt is my favorite. Next time you're looking for a pit stop at Sky Harbor, choose Four Peaks!

photos.caption: Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EsHot304btNtw3cocR_lAw.text: The Four Peaks Brewing Restaurant is locate for your convenience in the Phoenix Sky Harbor International airport. I enjoy a quick craft beer and burger here while waiting for my flight. The location is great to watch people interact with one another too. What a great Ideal to place this type of restaurant inside of the airport. It fun and opening, but the service is not always  fast. I believe it is this way because your meal are prepared when you order your food. I'm fine with this.  The selection was good and staff are accommodating. I like it. Thank you for good tasting food and good services.  Gloria~

s6XzwFvTbzuimazM_4x4-w.text: I actually liked this place.  Had the stout and it was super nice.  Service was good also, especially as the couple next to me were complaining from the moment they sat down.  The chap was saying how he hated Arizona,  right at the end I asked him where he was from and he said F'ing Texas !!  I had the cheese burger and it came in a timely manner and as I said before beer was good.  For an airport joint I was pleasantly surprised.    Will deffo visit next time I'm in Phoenix airport.

0bIdOTMuoqVhnqRmZiQd1g.text: Overpriced cheap food that is served by rude waitresses. Beer was just ok. For two burgers, two beers and  one mixed drink our total came to $69 without a tip. Here's a tip, STAY AWAY! THIS PLACE IS JUST TRYING TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF TRAVELS.

vQgJDmico9s0UILRE-CfPg.text: I had a lot of time to kill before my flight and needed a meal.  I couldn't bear the the thought of having lukewarm pizza or whatever else was laying around, so I ended up at Four Peaks.    The menu was ok and had a wide variety of the usual pub food staples and a lot of beers.  I ordered a chicken sandwich and a salad.  I got a bourbon as well.  The food was ok.  It came out a little dry, but wasn't terrible.  The salad was "meh", but wasn't the worst thing ever.  The service was ok, too.    I guess everything was ok, nothing was great, but nothing was crap, either.

JKSj6cjWDDvXR4LQ4m-lFQ.text: Can't even speak on the food because we left shortly after being seated. Sat at the front without being acknowledged, maybe 10 minutes later someone comes to finally greet us and seat us. Sits a party of 1 person at a 6 top and squished us at a small table. Blonde short hair Waitress was rude and seemed to be over customer service. We left and got food elsewhere before ordering anything, but not before the waitress snapped back at us about the options in the terminal.

XT8AREuFthq9_kv_VTF1bQ.text: Beer was good, and service was good too.  But the food was lackluster.  My husband's food came out well before mine.  Mine finally arrived, a garden burger, and the hubs were burnt.  They did bring more buns, but the middle of the patty was uncooked.  No offer to remove it from the ticket.

Cf94eeNuidGs89-7qSQB0A.text: Located Gate A21. Pretty clean for the day and time we got here. Stopped in because we had to wait to change flights. Beer battered fries are great and perfect with a nice cold beer (for my 21+ crowd of course)    Remember this is located in an airport terminal so don't have too high of an expectation. Especially if it's crazy crowded. Not the best place to go if you're in a rush.

KSuLqNXFlSeQiHPf_EW4Jw.text: Just don't do it. I am an all to frequent flyer in and out of Phoenix. The food here is just ok. The bar tenders attitudes are larger than the airport itself. What a pain. Every time I stop here  I ask myself why I did it again. Tonight is the last. Slow service bad attitudes and you only get away  with it because it's in an airport. Go anywhere elsel

BFCDbLI011JJ-L0IQMggKQ.text: Probably a great bar during day or evening but not for bkfst. Very fast service but just not a well cooked bkfst. Great music however

EbZJU4O9-4e7dfwHlaBWig.text: Long layover in Phoenix. Great food and recommendations from my server. Beers are excellent here. Try the Raj. My fav of three!

IlwjquMQKx5X2oqLpit9ZQ.text: If you should go here- the food service is the worst. Had cold egg breakfast with nasty fruit dish and toast that wasn't toasted. The service was marginally friendly and uncomfortably rushed. If you can, go somewhere else in the airport. If all you want is a beer- this is the place. Forget the food for sure. She took it off bill and I tipped her decently to covert what the meal and coffee would have cost. AND... in the time it took me to write the paragraph above I was just berated by bartender that I had time to have them make me another breakfast and suggested I was just complaining to get it free... rude, inappropriate, unprofessional and unbelievable! Yeah right... I have a little credit corporate card and sorry, breakfast was already covered by my company. Will not be back. Low class, no customer service or management presence. Frustrating experience to say the least. I hope to contact their corporate office shortly. At first I thought she was kidding, when I realized she was serious I was nearly speechless and yes, highly embarrassed and disrespected publicly.

qBaNbXrbu-rkxBqGJkXtXQ.text: Had a 2 hour layover in Phoenix and I always enjoy trying food that is "native" or local to the area I'm visiting, especially if I don't really plan to visit the city or area itself. As soon as I hopped off my plane, there was Four Peaks and as I looked over the menu- my choices were narrowed down to the Arizona Chicken Rolls or the Garlic Cheese Beer Bread..both sounded delicious and I wish I had stomach space for both. But thanks to the AMAZING attitude, service, and energy of my cashier (wish I could remember her name, she was super lively and helpful at giving me the best option on the menu for a first timer) I went with the chicken roll.  I would describe it similar to egg rolls you get at Chinese restaurants but a million times better! Inside the lightly fried pastry, there is grilled chicken, Anaheim chile's, pepper jack cheese, cream cheese and accompanied with a really tasty sweet jalapeno dressing. I enjoyed it all, only two come in an order but they are a good enough size that I felt satisfied after eating one and saved the other one to give to my siblings on my trip to miami. Only $8 for the rolls and we'll worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two Arizona Chicken Rolls with sweet  jalapeño dressing

3uyy1mv0KBNqlL4mfA245Q.text: 1 star based on the absolutely gross food. Eggbeaters are cooked in the morning in a large batch and kept warm until you order. Same with bacon and potatoes. We complained as well as the table next to us about the food. Waitress was friendly and checked on us often but I would highly recommend choosing another option available at the airport.

PxY6FFWPe7al1_gE9DEUzA.text: Let me preface this review by saying I absolutely LOVE Four Peaks proper in Tempe. I love their food, beer, ambiance... I love the yoga events they hold and I've always had great service there. Obviously I'm not expecting a free yoga event here at the airport, but I have felt on multiple occasions that the service at the airport location is lacking. It may be due to the fact that I'm usually taking a red eye out of PHX and visit towards the end of the shift - after all, who's peppy when they've been at work all day? My Hop Knot was predictably cold and tasty, though a large beer ran me $10 which seemed excessive even for an airport bar. I didn't get a chance to eat at the most recent visit, but the chicken strips and salmon BLT are my absolute favorites!

H4MnKAD9LKeQXGpCGjI1VQ.text: Food is highly overpriced, especially for the quality of food that you get. Also, one of the servers was incredibly snobby and acted like we were lower than dirt, and it seemed like she hated her job. The only reason I'm giving this place two stars is because our actual server was very nice, and he responded to our needs.  Long story short, don't treat travelers like shit just because you work in an airport. It's not our fault.

3HqYIpm7G_WFBTMDbM4QVg.text: Speaking of Airport Food prices . . .   Plane coming from Colorado was delayed by 2 hours 10 minutes.    So I went to Four Peaks Brewery & ordered a Ketel One Smoked Bloody Mary ~ Kettle One Vodka / Smoke / Loaded Bloody Mary Mix / Worcestershire Sauce / Server said it had a BBQ flavor.    It was perfectly blended & refreshing.    I don't know who started the trend of leaving the prices off the Cocktail menu many years ago.    I also ordered a Chef Salad ~ Ham / Turkey / Bacon / Egg / Gorgonzola / Candied Walnut / Cucumber / Tomato $13.  It too was delicious.    When the bill came, the Bloody Mary was (gulp) $15.  Plus tip.  That's a new high for me.    A $35 Lunch ~ no Soup / no Dessert.

X2cQCJrw4FQNvkAGXd9S0Q.text: The food here is mediocre at best and it takes forever to get your food, which is not ideal in an airport. On top of that, the servers are pretty rude and inattentive. I asked for more water about halfway through my meal and never got it. I ordered a sandwich on multigrain bread and when they brought me a sandwich on white bread, they seemed upset when I pointed out that they had messed up my order. I would recommend eating literally anywhere else in this airport.

ElepamQiOJpDJjH1Ya39cw.text: I'm not sure what I did to the bartender Veronica. But the gentlemen around me asked why I was always last..? I answered," I'm not really sure." I ordered first, ask first for a drink,.... got my food and drink almost 20 mins after the two gentlemen next to me. I just got a Turkey club. They both got French dip...? I said," I guess they were just busy in the kitchen." Then when I asked to get the check and everyone at the bar was waited on before me they both said,"Yes..... you made her mad some how..!" The only thing I can think of could have happened was asking for the check that was in the cup in front of me. It's a shame. The Turkey Club was awesome. The iced tea was good too. But whatever I did.... I'm so sorry Veronica. You kinda made it uncomfortable to dine at Four Peaks.

q9eG-o02NrVH_aRcKW7E2A.text: Visiting from out of town and saw this place had a great rating and wanted to check it out.  I had the Spinach Dip and Modern pizza.  The spinach dip was okay, however the cheese on top was barely melted and did not look appealing.  The modern pizza was also just okay as it was overly salty! Now with Prosciutto you expect some salt but I could not eat more than one piece due to only tasting salt.

yjjdLj-zP13eisBFvdIRNg.text: This place, even for a crappy sky mall restaurant sucks beyond measure. Half decent EXPENSIVE food with the worst service imaginable.  Servers ignored me as I sat for 10 minutes with no one approaching me. I finally flagged down the host to have someone take my order and he seemed offended I was speaking to him. At last a rude waitress approached and made a half-assed apology, took my order and then stood at the bar, bored and affected the rest of my time there. My food came out undercooked and very expensive. I left no tip and never will for this kind of treatment. Chubby and affected millenial staff who were only nice to people who resemble themselves. Disgusting! Save your money.

QwPMqZnTzsFRwTWni96MjQ.text: Waitress was great but the food is terrible. Ordered  breakfast came out very fast since the eggs are prepared well in advanced ( Like a day).  Old couple next to us told the waitress "the food sucks" lol.  Good place if you only want a drink.  Feel sorry for the waitress cause she was very nice.

e2-okcPUqS85kZ4N0CvEWA.text: We waited 10 minutes before the server even came to our table and when he did- he said He was sorry and would find our server and five minutes later he came back as our server! Throughout our meal we had to hunt him down to get our drinks, not once did he come to our table voluntarily. His service was the absolute worst! And my food didn't even come out right . I ordered fish and chips and part of my meal had chicken strips. He did give me $15 off my bill and when I chose not to tip , I heard him complain to another server that we didn't tip even after he gave us a discount! What he should have said was how could I have gotten a tip from this customer? How could I have improved my service to this customer? What can I do differently to earn a tip?

GzL3zj_LN0rTzxycZkXChg.text: Sam is an excellent waitress. Friendly with good recommendations.  We had the salmon blt and chicken enchiladas.

Incum_8QvnkkKIdOSU4PWA.text: Food and beers are absolutely amazing, four peaks always has good good and beer! The service is so so, it's an airport though with constant traffic and a lot of people flowing through the restaurant. I'd strongly recommend sitting at the bar for quick service! Give yourself about 30-45 minutes before your flight too.

QMGZHEaWZbMvfP94EK16Rg.text: Works in a pinch however my silverware was dirty and the coffee was very weak.  Will not go there again. Silverware should be cleaned and then polished before giving to customers.

3QhxlvDZnsGthau2x4bwug.text: Decent place to grab a drink and some food before a flight, and compared to airports it's great, but compared to the other awesome offerings at PHX, this is not as great. However if you are in this gate it's your best option unless you won't to hoof it over to B or C.   The menu is small, the prices are airport-high, and the portions are small. No healthy options that looked appetizing and next to no vegetarian options other than quesadillas and fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese quesadilla

bnp7o7jFJzdyK7NRoBzFpw.text: Super incredible service. This place is busy! My bartender Heather was a complete doll and I only drank water. It's super hot in PHX! The burger (cheddar and bacon) was wonderful on a toasted bun!!!! Yummy!

E8836oUnIH5FPIY6f9HuvQ.text: Kilt lifter is delicious and great before a flight! The food ain't bad either. Bartender is kinda shitty but it's whatever

photos.caption: Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kilt lifter!

6aBRfYs0_uTD_9U3PyqCcQ.text: Just got turned away after walking from the B gates because they "closed at 9" and it's 8:58 and the bar is full. Multiple places show they close at 10 or 11. Completely unacceptable.

4thzcfLB2RlZWBoPsabRFQ.text: Why didn't I know that four peaks is in the airport?! I am a nervous nelly prior to any flight and their kilt lifter is the cure. Terminal 4 gates A . Even with the entire bar being surrounded by eager drinkers, the bartenders are getting everyone their order on time.

n-NyUGVHioctOmtN5Aypjw.text: Good food and service/ hummus was delicious .  Spicy salmon BLT was very tasty. Service was quick

photos.caption: Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hummas as starter

bFMAeZBv1f1lJK-bwSoHCA.text: Like everything in the airport, it's a bit pricey and not that comfortable. I'm a huge fan of their original Tempe location so was excited to stop in here before my flight to my new home in Minnesota. I was a little disappointed with the quality and service and more limited menu. If you have time, go to the actual location and only utilize this one for a quick beer before your flight.

sahjrRFxiebkHJmT_sbn3Q.text: I had a  short layover at PDX on my way home from Mexico. Four Peaks was right across from my gate and since I was in desperate need of an IPA after drinking crappy Mexican beers for the past two weeks, decided to give it a try.  The place was packed and the staff was really busy but I was able to score a seat at the bar and the cute bartender quickly brought me a tasty Raj IPA.I also had the Bavarian pretzels which were just OK - a little too gooey with a lot of butter melted on them. Based on the beer, I'd definitely go back the next time I'm at PDX

photos.caption: Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nom nom nom

rokx8g8I55Y9OmxRFomc6A.text: Sweet spot of food, libations, and your next flight out of town.  I don't always fly out of the A gates at Sky Harbor, but when I do I make sure to visit 4Peaks.

G9L9isbmWWM-kEx8KYKQyQ.text: As I travel a lot for work, Phoenix is always my favorite spot to go.  They have great restaurants here!  Luckily I ran into my favorite Server from Zinc, Natalie!  She is 100% honest when you ask her what she thinks of specific items.  She told me not to get a soup and I did.  She was more than willing to take it off the bill and get me something else to eat. All you gotta do is be polite and nice and everyone will go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The food was good for airport and bar food. Not exactly top notch but I was satisfied. The fries were the best! Natalie recommended trying all the different styles of ranch and they are fantastic.  Next time I'm going to have to come in for all the beers!

Ifi2jcv6Ck4hrsAbZdKIfg.text: This place rocks, went there because they had flights (I have trouble committing to 1 beer). Their beer was sooo good. the peach and pumpkin were my favorite and all their food was delicious!. I got the blackened salmon not. service was good, we did have a wait... probably a while longer because we wanted to sit outside.

KQowlymev6tyWF8DRoKpSg.text: Horrible food! Horrible service! I would die starving before I would eat there again...

rteHfcEI3upc5wWG5z2C8Q.text: A full service restaurant in the Phoenix airport that serves breakfast? Yes, please! Our food was great and service was speedy and courteous. Unfortunately, it was too early for drinking but of course they had a full set of taps for all our Four Peaks favorite brews. I will stop here again before my next flight.  They are located in the northwest section of Terminal 4, in the US Airways section for gates A15-A30.

YdRbDd0XCzClqk1xndRPaA.text: Just had the unfortunate experience of this location. To start with the bar smelled like dirty rags. There were a whopping 12 people at the bar and probably as many employees. Beer decent if you can get over the stench of a dirty bar. Food mediocre as I had to get my 2nd choice because they were out of the 1st. For as slow as it was and as many employees as they had working I would think someone could have asked me if my food was ok or if I wanted my empty glass refilled with another $8 beer. I thought when I brought my own water bottle out someone would have asked if I wanted water.  They were more concerned with changing tv stations to watch what they wanted and playing grab ass with each-other.

gHNFzcOTUsvaX30TXabd5g.text: I have enjoyed Four Peeks at every location I have ever been to. This location is limited on the menu. What they do have is excellent. The bartender is exceptional. The location is convenient, if you are flying out of this terminal. You almost forget where you are because of the ambiance and quality service. I would say I will definitely look forward to a lay over in this terminal.

VTn9BzEInPprqR2MEBDyUA.text: For airport food it's great. The burger was freshly made as were the fries. The drinks are very good. It's expensive as all get out, but hey they have no competition. Our server was friendly and efficient ... again two things that are basically lacking in airport operations these days. They seem to specialize in beer, and as a result have a limited drink menu. But what they do have, they serve well ... and they do not skimp on them either. I had a sandwich that had lots of meat on it, and was well presented. Next time I am in the airport in Phoenix, and if I have the time to spend, I will be back. It was a pleasant diversion from the normal run run run and getting yelled at by TSA people.

iQUPzpVoq1EvC60F-KwZdw.text: Got the Four Peaks Cheeseburger, which is a charbroiled patty with swiss cheese and fries for $9.50 (with tax is $10.19).  Overall, not bad but not amazing. Juicy but over cooked (medium rare seemed medium well). Fries were a little overly salty.. but not bad.

nLRYqUfq7sydMsBb6QQVOg.text: Not one to complain I usually eat here while waiting for flight out.  Usually love their Blacken Salmon BLT. this trip not so much.  The ice tea was murky sent first one back second one went back too. The bacon on the sandwicwas raw, seriously undercooked.  The blacken salmon must have been used to soak up the grease from a spill.  To top it off it took over 20 minutes to be served this.  Sad the fries were good but I was too grossed out to enjoy.  The server was nice tho

sfoNaLGd9aRcu2a9jqNEVg.text: While waiting between flights - this place was a gem! We needed a real breakfast, not another Danish & it was very good.  French toast with perfectly cooked bacon & these terrific crispy potatoes.  Wait staff was good also.

_WI410idv__isFHMN2a0WA.text: Unbelievable. Decide to close at 9:30pm despite a line at least 10 people deep and seats available. Reason given "we lose more money than we make after 9:30".  Idiots. Packed bar, only place open and they close. If they lose more meant than they make sue g a time when their place is packed, hate to think why quiet times do to the financials.

W4CKffepKvj7wWla_VBV1w.text: Heh, It's airport fare quick and easy nothing special nothing terrible.

pVqMeYyoxPEUQagi5axGUQ.text: I absolutely love Four Peaks! They have my favorite beer (Peach Ale) and an amazing Chicken Salad Pita and Outstanding pasta salad. I love the busy but upbeat feel here and go all the time with friends. I am dreaming of the Peach Ale right now..   If visiting AZ this place is AMAZING and has something to offer for even the pickist of eaters. Enjoy!

zlvMxyTH8j4hRhY8HLpWdQ.text: Decently good food for an airport.  The Chicken Enchiladas were actually pretty good.  Or to rephrase that, better than I expected them to be.  Of course coming off of a red eye that served no meals just about anything tastes good.  Still, better than I expected.

AjtkMeSTHf9pGfFqVulEEg.text: $5 craft beer pints.  In an airport.  Whaaaaa??  Best. Airport. Deal. Ever.    Even though it's cheap beer, don't expect the quality to disappoint.  They put out a good product!  If you're looking for a beer in the airport, do yourself a favor and stop in here so you can get a real beer, vs. some $8 macro crap served in most other airport bars.  Their wheat and IPA were good, but don't take my word for it...Untappd and BeerAdvocate like their product as well.    Don't fall into the trap of the 20oz beer though; at $7, it's more expensive per ounce.  $16 oz is where it's at.

H3Jc0MipRmW0nQASjTysDA.text: Definitely never stopping here for anything ever again... Sticking to the actual location for sure.  The service is probably one of the slowest waits for our food and drinks ever.  What kills me is when the man was saying "its made fresh" in regards to the wait time is why it was taking forever.  I believe that to be the biggest crock of S**t coming out of someones mouth coming from an airport establishment.  The Italian beer bread was NOT fresh.  The bread didn't even look right or taste right at that.  So not only was I irritated by the wait time with the word "FRESH" thrown one time after another (in which became a family joke from here on out is that its "FRESH") but i was severely disappointed on top of it with our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Four Peaks Brewing Company - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Doesn&#39;t look right

QREpfGsLRQdNYeKyDfHNvA.text: Service is straight trash. 30 minutes before I got a water that I requested. 45 mins for my food. The only reason why I walked in here was because I wanted to watch the Warriors drub the Rockets.   Service team is disorganized and lack etiquette. Slamming condiments on the table when they replace them.   Food was alright. But not worth the wait at all.

Tl5NHrc7DeUc0WBfIdbPHQ.text: Zero Stars... if you have an early flight, DO NOT count on this place opening early, open on time, or even have warm food to serve.  This place sucks something fierce for AM flyers.  Don't waste your time...

_w4BR2jUruZp0qRzfRIN1g.text: Good for airport food. Not an extensive menu- mostly burgers but you can get your burger with beef, chicken or veggie patty (I think that was the other option....). And I didn't get one but saw a few entree salads that looked really nice too.   Got the blue cheese burger with chicken and side salad instead of fries. Chicken was juicy and good flavor/toppings. Side salad was just iceberg lettuce but had cucumber, cherry tomatoes, green peppers and mushrooms- so nice little salad.   Waiter (Matt) was very friendly and quick.   Reasonable prices considering it is at the airport.

MptpEnGxaRictTzOZGxZ_A.text: Excellent beer on draft along with decent pub food make this an enjoyable place to wait for a flight.    Sports on tvs and friendly service helps.

nr7YHJi7uaKbVIn8RsGTzA.text: Airport bars are crazy, Not bad but the service was not great. I ordered IPA and enjoyed people watching but I was no offered another and I was handed my check before I was  ready to leave.   I love to drink but not in a rush.

27prs8Zb0KJYTEuJCD_5gg.text: This place was just the place for a nice breakfast while waiting for our connection.  All of the staff we interacted with was very nice and cheerful even though it was like 7 am. We definitely enjoyed this little joint  and it is an actual brewery

ydrVItmdGMCauoXY6JeiTQ.text: This review is for the "To-Go" section.   Service is very rude and the cashier had no clue what the order menu has on it. Otherwise, the food was quick and the fries are pretty good. The staff could use a little class on how to be friendly.

n_KMT9B2AuA2iUBFCFKfog.text: Perfect spot for a layover. I had a southwest burger and an IPA. It was delish! Jeffrey our server was attentive and friendly. I usually expect the worst when dining at airport establishments but this was a pleasant surprise. I'll definitely be back!

Wu39TPQgF3-A5wHWX496zw.text: Airport bars are notorious for overpriced drinks, and mediocre food. Like an oasis in the desert, Four Peaks offers travelers a respite, with good locally produced beer, and decent food. Had the Raj IPA, and a chicken quesadilla. The IPA was good, not overly hopped but nice balance. The chicken quesadilla was a bit bland, but some hot sauce kicked it up a notch. Would definitely park there again.

dolllgqCBDDrHKoUdIDqmw.text: In the time I have been here, 3 complaints were made about there check, order, and time it took to be served. Every situation was handled with the waitresses talking crap about each costumer behind me where I was sitting. My meal was nothing special. The water was horrible. Sad

88AWLhwEnakiY0VPBAVj_Q.text: Don't be deceived by the hours. They close when they want. Tonight they decided to close at 9:30pm on a Saturday night.

a3ORcjosOcjrwm1MNX2KYA.text: went there for a beer and a appetizer.  The appetizer took forever considering it was just hummus. Checked my account two days later and I was charged twice for my food/drinks
